sen.j: 山あらし、山荒（やまあらし）は、尾田淑による妖怪画『百鬼夜行絵巻』などにある日本の妖怪。
sen.e: Yama-arashi is a Japanese Yokai (specter) introduced in books such as a Yokai picture book, "Hyakki Yagyo Emaki" (picture scroll of a hundred specters strolling at night) by Yoshi ODA.

sen.j: 『百鬼夜行絵巻』では、棘状の突起に全身を覆われた獣の姿として描かれている。
sen.e: In "Hyakki Yagyo Emaki", Yama-arashi is illustrated as a beast whose entire skin is covered with needle-like projections.
In "Hyakki Yagyo Emaki (picture scroll of a hundred specters strolling at night)", Yama-arashi is illustrated as a beast whose entire skin is covered with spines.
sen.cmt: 『百鬼夜行絵巻』の英訳を二度目ですが、項目が変わったため補充しました。また、needle-like projectionsの代わりにヤマアラシのとげを指すspineを入れました。
sen.e: In "Hyakki Yagyo Emaki (picture scroll of a hundred specters strolling at night)", Yama-arashi is illustrated as a beast whose entire skin is covered with spines.

sen.j: 一切の解説文がないため、どのような妖怪を意図して描かれたものかは想像の域を出ないが、妖怪ではなく実在の動物であるヤマアラシを描いたもの、またはヤマアラシが全身の棘によって相手を威嚇するという断片的な情報が妖怪視されたもの、などの説がある。
sen.e: Because no detailed description is attached to it, no one can be sure what kind of Yokai the Yama-arashi represents, but some say that the Yama-arashi is not Yokai but merely an illustrated figure of the real animal, porcupine (yama-arashi in Japanese), or that fragmented information that a porcupine uses its needles to threaten other animals created the fictitious Yokai, Yama-arashi.

sen.cmt: 妖怪の訳を再挿入しました。また、needlesは裁縫などに使う針のことなので、ヤマアラシの針を指すspinesに置き換えました。
sen.e: Because no detailed description is attached to it, no one can be sure what kind of Yokai (specter) the Yama-arashi represents, but some say that the Yama-arashi is not Yokai but merely an illustrated figure of the real animal, porcupine (yama-arashi in Japanese), or that fragmented information that a porcupine uses its spines to threaten other animals created the fictitious Yokai, Yama-arashi.

sen.j: この画との関連性は不明だが、ヤマアラシという名の妖怪は日本各地の民間伝承に見られる。
sen.e: However, there is folklore on Yokai Yama-arashi in various places across Japan, although the connection between the painted Yama-arashi and the folklore has not been verified.
Although the connection with the painted Yama-arashi has not been verified, there is folklore on Yokai (specter) Yama-arashi in various places across Japan,
sen.cmt: この場合althoughとhoweverを同時に使えないため、原文と同じ順番で訳し直しました。また妖怪の訳specterを入れました。
sen.e: Although the connection with the painted Yama-arashi has not been verified, there is folklore on Yokai (specter) Yama-arashi in various places across Japan,

sen.j: 和歌山県有田郡廣村（現・広川町 (和歌山県)）や広島県山県郡 (広島県)では、ヤマアラシは別名を「シイ」といい、毛を逆立てる姿をウシがたいへん恐れるので、牛を飼う者は牛に前進させる際に「後ろにシイがいるぞ」という意味で「シイシイ」と命令するのだという。
sen.e: In Arita County of Wakayama Prefecture (present-day Hirokawa Town, Wakayama Prefecture) and Yamagata County of Hiroshima Prefecture, Yama-arashi is also called 'Shii'; cow keepers often say 'Shii, Shii', meaning 'there is Yama-arashi on your back', to move cows forward as cows are very scared of porcupines full of needles.

In Arita County of Wakayama Prefecture (present-day Hirokawa Town, Wakayama Prefecture) and Yamagata County of Hiroshima Prefecture, Yama-arashi is also called 'Shii'; cow keepers often say 'Shii, Shii', meaning 'Yama-arashi is behind you', to move cows forward as cows are very scared of porcupines full of spines.
sen.cmt: シイの「背中の上」ではなく、シイの「後方」なのでon the backの代わりにbehindを使用しました。また、there is を削除し、短くすることでより臨場感を出しました。ヤマアラシの棘を指すspinesを普通の針のneedlesの代わりに入れました。

sen.j: また奈良県吉野郡大塔村 (奈良県)では、山で木を伐る音をたてる怪物といわれる。
sen.e: In Daito Village, Yoshino County of Nara Prefecture, Yama-arashi is referred to as a monster which makes noise of cutting trees in mountains.
In Daito Village, Yoshino County of Nara Prefecture, Yama-arashi is said to be a monster which makes noise of cutting trees in mountains.
sen.cmt: referの使い方に違和感があったため、「～といわれる」のスタンダードな訳is said to beにしました。
sen.e: In Daito Village, Yoshino County of Nara Prefecture, Yama-arashi is said to be a monster which makes noise of cutting trees in mountains.

sen.j: 江戸時代の書物『大和本草』『和漢三才図会』『斎諧俗談』などではシイに「黒眚」という漢字表記をあてている。
sen.e: In the literature from the Edo period, such as "Yamato-honzo", "Wakan Sansai Zue" and "Saikai Zokudan", Shii is described as 黒眚 in Kanji.
In the literature from the Edo period, such as "Yamato-honzo", "Wakan Sansai Zue" and "Saikai Zokudan", Shii is written 黒眚 in Kanji, which means ''black disaster.''
sen.cmt: 文字表記についてなのでdescribeをwriteに変更しました。また黒眚の英訳を付け加えました。
sen.e: In the literature from the Edo period, such as "Yamato-honzo", "Wakan Sansai Zue" and "Saikai Zokudan", Shii is written '黒眚' in Kanji, which means ''black disaster.''

sen.j: 『大和本草』では黒眚は周防国（現・山口県）や筑紫国（現・福岡県）におり、やはり牛馬に害をなすもので、賢い上に素早いのでなかなか捕えることはできないとある。
sen.e: "Yamato Honzo" says that 黒眚 lives in Suo Province (present-day Yamaguchi Prefecture) and Tsukushi Province (present-day Fukuoka Prefecture), and it harms cattle and horses and is hard to catch for being smart and quick to move.

According to "Yamato Honzo," ''Shii'' is said to have lived in Suo Province (present-day Yamaguchi Prefecture) and Tsukushi Province (present-day Fukuoka Prefecture), and to have harmed cattle and horses and it was not easy to catch as it was very smart and could move very fast.
sen.cmt: 黒眚をローマ字表記に変更しました。また現在も黒眚が存在するとの誤解釈を避けるため、時制を過去形にしました。最後の部分は主語が変わっているのに省略されていたため、主語を一部変えて訳しました。
sen.e: According to "Yamato Honzo," ''Shii'' is said to have lived in Suo Province (present-day Yamaguchi Prefecture) and Tsukushi Province (present-day Fukuoka Prefecture), and to have harmed cattle and horses and it was not easy to catch as it was very smart and could move very fast.

sen.j: 『斎諧俗談』では奈良県吉野郡にいるものとされ、人間はこれに触れただけで顔、手足、喉まで傷つけられるとある。
sen.e: Meanwhile, "Saikai Zokudan" says that it lives in Yoshino County of Nara Prefecture and can hurt face, arms and legs and even throat of humans if they merely touch the monster.
According to "Saikai Zokudan," it is said to have lived in Yoshino County of Nara Prefecture and could hurt face, arms and legs and even throat of humans just by touching the monster.
sen.cmt: Meanwhileは特に必要ないと判断し、削除しました。また上記と同様の理由で過去形を採用しました。またmerelyよりも使用頻度が高いjustで置き換え、byを使ってよりシンプルな構文に書き換えました。
sen.e: According to "Saikai Zokudan," it is said to have lived in Yoshino County of Nara Prefecture and could hurt face, arms and legs and even throat of humans just by touching the monster.

sen.j: この黒眚とは本来は中国の伝承にある怪物の名であり、江戸期の書物にある黒眚は、日本の正体不明の怪物にこの中国の黒眚の名を当てはめたに過ぎないとの説もある。
sen.e: Some people say that 黒眚 was a Chinese monster in origin as often mentioned in Chinese folklore, and in Japan, the description 黒眚 appeared in these Edo literatures is merely an alias for unidentified monsters.

Some people say that ''Shii'' was a Chinese monster in origin as often mentioned in Chinese folklore, and in Japan, ''Shii'' in the literature of the Edo period is merely an alias for unidentified monsters.
sen.cmt: 黒眚をローマ字表記に変更しました。また、「黒眚の描写」ではなく「黒眚」についての説明なのでdescriptionを削除しました。ｌiteratureは不可算名詞のためsを削除、原文には特に「これらの書物」と無いためtheseからtheに変更しました。
